visualization.title: Maximum Observed Call Load Text
visualization.visState:
{"title":"Maximum Observed Call Load Text","type":"markdown","params":{"fontSize":12,"openLinksInNewTab":false,"markdown":"Maximum call load observed when a new incident arrives
---
**The chloropleth map to the right** displays the maximum observed number of incidents in progress in a given census tract when a final incident arrived over the time window in the top right corner. A map such as this supplies the historically observed "worst case" scenarios for each census tract, which, coupled with considerations of the department-level demand at these times, may aid in planning for and communicating reasoning behind "worst case" scenario incident response situations faced by your department.

Likewise, **the heat map to the right** shows the highest observed number of incidents already in progress _when one more incident arrives_ for a given hour of day and day of week, again helping visualize how possible "worst case" scenarios for incident demand might look."},"aggs":[]}
